file_content.text: Thanks again for your help.
We got your information, and we ran into a speaking Colicoid who wanted to work with the Empire to continue the experiments.
I got your information, and I ran into a speaking Colicoid who wanted to work with the Empire to continue the experiments.
A speaking Colicoid? Repulsive. Fascinating.
I wasn't aware that these monsters were ever sentient. This unlocks new potential, opens up entirely new avenues of exploration.
Truly great work... commendable. I can't thank you enough.
We need to know every detail about the Colicoid experiments.
Excuse me... excuse me... pardon. Kanju's disease. I'll have my wind back in a minute.
That's better. Doctor Revis, Imperial Science Bureau. Welcome to Project Hexapod. Not much, is it? Just me and a couple of obsolete computers.
Empire's throwing all its resources into the war. What little good it does. But maybe you can help me.
Maybe you can tell me what it is you need help with.
What do you need?
Spare me the sob story.
We all have problems.
I'm not angling for sympathy here.
We might be able to reach some kind of agreement.
Possibly.
The goal... excuse me, the goal of Project Hexapod is to analyze the weaponization of the Colicoids on Balmorra.
You're familiar with the weaponized Colicoids, right? You can't miss them. The results of some kind of sick, wonderful experiments. Got loose when the Empire bombed the place.
I'm here to uncover and analyze every scrap, every detail of those perverse, amazing experiments. Where, why, who, how, what. And then put it to good use.
Grotesque experiments on mutated life-forms--I'm surprised the Empire wasn't responsible.
The Empire doesn't know?
Missed opportunity, isn't it?
The pursuit of knowledge is endless, isn't it?
Consider me intrigued.
Knowledge is all well and good, but I'm more interested in the practical applications.
People mostly hire me for live bounties, but I can get information just as easy.
As long as the pay's good.
The Empire hasn't given me much to work with, but I think I can manage a suitable payment.
I don't usually run errands for sickly old men.
Why should I help you?
Scientific inquiry has its side effects. I gave my lungs to the Empire. All I'm asking is your time.
What do you mean by "good use"?
Good use?
The Colicoid mutations are disgusting and remarkable, but they are only the barest hint of what we might accomplish.
These creatures are vicious enough already, don't you think?
Sounds like madness.
We won't know until we try, will we? Either way, we find out what happened, we might be able to control them.
I've located "ground zero" of the Colicoid experiments, but between the mutated Colicoids and my bad lungs, I can't get in.
Need you to... need you to take this data spike and upload every scrap of information on those experiments you can find. Not just the formula. Everything.
Consider it done.
I guess I can spare the time.
Good to hear. Project Hexapod might not be a wash after all.
Ground zero isn't far from here. Big lab facility. Hard to miss. Good luck out there.
Forget it. [Refuse quest]
I think you're missing the bigger picture. We have the ideal model of the invasive species, here. Imagine if we had the research and could expand on it!
You change your mind, you let me know.
Sorry... busy.
